div.p: TGENREISSUE is an element (belonging conceptually in WRITING TEXTUALFEATURE . It that allows you to talk generally about the genre issues raised by a specific text, or about an unusual mixture of genre forms. It therefore requires full sentences. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes, but it has an ancillary element in TGENRE with attribute GENRENAME, which should occur in every use of TGENREISSUE.

div.codeblock: <TGENREISSUE>At this date, to write the <TGENRE GENRENAME=”hagiography”>life of a saint</TGENRE> was nothing unusual; to write the <TGENRE GENRENAME=”biography”>biography</TGENRE> of a mother or another woman writer was unheard of. </TGENREISSUE>

div.p: This element should be reserved for larger issues in genre like whether or not Margery Kempe's Boke is the first work of autobiography in English, and for writers’ comments on the nature of a genre they wrote.
